1017920222127325184.text: .@profdavidharvey: "In Silicon Valley, they want a universal basic income so people will have enough money to pay for Netflix, and that’s it. What kind of world is that? Talk about a dystopia."https://jacobinmag.com/2018/07/karl-marx-capital-david-harvey …

1017905112105316352.text: .@profdavidharvey: "The Left should be working on a politics in which we say, we welcome automation, but it should give us much more free time."https://jacobinmag.com/2018/07/karl-marx-capital-david-harvey …

1017790253254529026.text: "In order to build alliances, you have to have a picture of the totality of a capitalist society. To the degree that you can get some of that from studying Marx, I think that it’s helpful."https://jacobinmag.com/2018/07/karl-marx-capital-david-harvey …

1017740431637876736.text: "We’re going to have to deal with capital accumulation, which is about 3 percent growth forever, as a clear environmental issue. There’s not going to be a solution to the environmental issue without confronting capital accumulation."https://jacobinmag.com/2018/07/karl-marx-capital-david-harvey …

1017759303925575682.text: "Struggles over the environment, over the production of new wants, needs, and desires, and consumerism are related to the forms of production. Put all of these things together and you get a picture of the totality of what a capitalist society is about."https://jacobinmag.com/2018/07/karl-marx-capital-david-harvey …

1017578105563688960.text: "In Silicon Valley, they want a universal basic income so people will have enough money to pay for Netflix, and that’s it. What kind of world is that? Talk about a dystopia."https://jacobinmag.com/2018/07/karl-marx-capital-david-harvey …

1017462341657550848.text: "We’re taught that the capitalist economic system is highly rational. But it’s not."https://jacobinmag.com/2018/07/karl-marx-capital-david-harvey …

1017478699816509441.text: "Marx said the problem with capital is not that it’s immoral. The problem with capital is that it’s almost amoral. To try to confront it with moral reason is never going to get very far, because the system is self-generating and self-reproducing."https://jacobinmag.com/2018/07/karl-marx-capital-david-harvey …

1017496315532599296.text: "There’s no such thing as a good, moral idea that capital can’t co-opt and turn into something horrendous.  Almost every utopian schema that’s come across the horizon over the last hundred years has been turned into a dystopia by the capitalist dynamic."https://jacobinmag.com/2018/07/karl-marx-capital-david-harvey …

1017506382700994560.text: "Capital has built the capacity, technologically and organizationally, to create a far better world. But it does so through social relations of domination rather than emancipation. That is the central contradiction."https://jacobinmag.com/2018/07/karl-marx-capital-david-harvey …

1017520223891714048.text: "We’ve got to think about a progressive future, using all the technologies we have, but using them for a social purpose rather than increasing wealth and power in fewer and fewer hands."https://jacobinmag.com/2018/07/karl-marx-capital-david-harvey …

1017566780510748672.text: "The Left should be working on a politics in which we say, 'we welcome artificial intelligence and automation, but they should give us much more free time.'"https://jacobinmag.com/2018/07/karl-marx-capital-david-harvey …

1017541110313304064.text: "In effect, you’ve got a right-wing politics which is gathering a great deal of support by being anti-immigrant and anti-offshoring. But the fact is, the biggest problem of jobs is not offshoring, it’s technological change."https://jacobinmag.com/2018/07/karl-marx-capital-david-harvey …

1017507063122087937.text: My @thedigradio interview with @profdavidharvey is now available in transcript form @jacobinmag.https://twitter.com/profdavidharvey/status/1017437999116800001 …

1017471072214675456.text: "The neoliberal argument had a lot of legitimacy in the 1980s and 1990s as being liberatory in some way. But nobody believes that anymore. Everybody realizes it’s a con job in which the rich get richer and the poor get poorer."https://jacobinmag.com/2018/07/karl-marx-capital-david-harvey …

1017447710130044929.text: "Debt is a claim on future production. So the future is foreclosed on, because we’ve got to pay our debts. Ask any student who owes $200,000: their future is foreclosed, because they’ve got to pay off that debt."https://jacobinmag.com/2018/07/karl-marx-capital-david-harvey …
